intro: Bidens leptopoda, commonly known as the smallleaf tickseed, is an annual flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, hairy stems and narrow, alternate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its bright yellow flowers consist of both ray and disk florets, typical of the daisy family. Bidens leptopoda is often found in moist, open habitats such as roadsides and wetlands.
